definition: orally transmitted
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
biography/historical narrative/commentaries/relay station
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: Nianboyuze Snowy Mountain myth fable is a generation of oral instruction that inspires true understanding.
sentences.chinese: 年寶玉則雪山神話傳說爲代代口傳心授。

sentences.english: We also know,though,about oral traditions in Paul's letters.
sentences.chinese: 我們也知道保羅書信的口傳傳統。

sentences.english: Oral epics are a lasting cultural phenomenon among nations all around the world.
sentences.chinese: 口傳史詩是世界上許多民族都流傳不息的文化現象。

sentences.english: Why are legends handed down by storytellers useful?
sentences.chinese: 爲何傳奇故事口傳下來很有用？

sentences.english: It be a kind of vocal music art which spread heart to teach to teaching.
sentences.chinese: 它是以口傳心授來教學的一種聲樂藝術。

sentences.english: Some scholars who study comparative literature and folk tales held a seminar about it.
sentences.chinese: 中外幾位比較文學與口傳文學研究者就此進行了座談。

sentences.english: It's better than just rumor or hearsay or oral tradition.
sentences.chinese: 它比傳聞或口傳傳統要好。

sentences.english: We know that there were oral traditions about Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道關於耶穌的口傳傳統。

sentences.english: I am able to take dictation in English and translate it rapidly into Dhellonese.
sentences.chinese: 我會英文的口傳條記，同時能當行將其傳譯成中文。

sentences.english: Of written and oral form, there are rumors tablet contains prophecy.
sentences.chinese: 書面和口傳的形式之外，還有碑載讖謠。

sentences.english: His Holiness gave the oral transmission in order to recite the six syllable mantra.
sentences.chinese: 此前，法王噶瑪巴給予了六字大明咒的口傳。

sentences.english: Questions about the relevance and persistence of oral traditions are not new.
sentences.chinese: 有關口傳藝術的重要性及持久性的問題都是老生常談。

sentences.english: The question is: Can the "valuable advice" could "oral teaching that inspires true understanding within"?
sentences.chinese: 問題是，“金口玉言”是否就能夠“口傳心授”了呢？

definition: study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
when you teach someone, both teacher and student will benefit
diligent and attentive/assiduous/sincere
to pass on the light of Buddha
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
work or plans left as a legacy/the views of the departed/posthumous orders or teachings
authentic tradition/handed-down teachings or techniques
Nagarjuna (Nagarjuna Bodhisattva)
mnemonic chant/rhyme for remembering (arithmetic tables, character stroke order etc)
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
to translate/to interpret
to become enlightened (Buddhism)
to study/to practice
to spread/to hand down/to disseminate
